data.title: The Tallest Structure in Portland!
data.text:
This is one of the finest structures in New England! I always recommend visits to the Catholic Churches for Catholics and non-Catholics alike. Often much of the history and architectural riches of a region rest within the Church building. If you plan to attend Mass make sure you check specifically for Cathedral times since this is part of a five-parish grouping (Saturday Vigil is at 4 pm. Sunday Masses are at 8, 10, 12 (Latin) and 5). For non-Catholics, please be mindful of those there to worship.

This is a magnificent building and is on the National Register of Historic Places. The style is considered neo-Gothic and the largely white interior reminds me of many other colonial buildings. It is also considered to be the tallest structure in Portland. This is definitely a historic site, if that's what you're seeking. Once you're done looking at the Cathedral you can check out the Eastern Cemetery across the street for another historical site.

data.title: Imposing sight
data.text: From a distance, you can see this imposing church on a hilltop.  Beautiful vaulted ceilings, on National Historic register.
